Question: This person sprang to fame with the 1836 serial publication of The Pickwick Papers.
Hints: As the idea for the story took shape and the writing began in earnest, this person became engrossed in the book.
Prone to living beyond his means, John **** was imprisoned in the Marshalsea debtors' prison in Southwark London in 1824.
On the expectation of this legacy, this person was granted release from prison.
